channel.title: Free Money, Clothes etc
channel.description:
1) Go to your local asda, tesco or whatever. 2) Go to the clothes department 3) Find some WITHOUT a security tag 4) Make sure you have an asda bag or something similar 5) Go to cash desk and say you baught it and would like a refund because it is too small or whatever excuse you can come up with. You dont have a reciept so ask for a credit note, or if you want the same item ask them to replace it with your size :)
Genius.

item.title: Free Money, Clothes etc
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

I’ve been getting good at shop lifting lately. If your in a department store, just keep moving while your stealing. My coat has a ski net on the inside, so I can just chuck stuff into my coat and there is a big net to hold it all in. As long as you get rid of the barcode then it is easy as hell to steal, just cut it out quickly and keep walking the entire time. And never steal from your area.

Read full topic

item.title: Free Money, Clothes etc
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:10, topic:48889”]I meant that that phrase was from the Old Testament, of which Jesus revealed the true meaning of many of the laws laid down there.

[quote author=Jesus]You have heard that it was said, ‘An eye for an eye and a tooth for a tooth.’
But I say to you, offer no resistance to one who is evil. When someone strikes you on (your) right cheek, turn the other one to him as well.
[/quote][/quote]

Ha, “quote from Jesus”

But on topic, some upscale stores have started using RFID tags for their doorway shoplifting detectors. Either make one of these or bring a knife and just wear the crap out. Bring it back to the same store or a different one in the same chain on the other side of town…I laughed when I realized they were doing this, RFID is not security tech.

Read full topic

item.title: Free Money, Clothes etc
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:6, topic:48889”]Don’t christians have some eye for an eye clause that allows them to do pretty much whatever the fuck they want, if it’s been done to them?

In that case, steal away.[/quote]

No they don’t. That was in the Old Testament. Christians have the “turn the cheek” philosophy. So the next time a Mexican steals your bike, you buy a new one; this time, without a lock.

Read full topic
